intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. minor, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often found in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in open, sunny environments with well-drained soil.
